metadata.name: Virtual Networks
metadata.description: This module deploys a Virtual Network (vNet).
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container"
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to 'AllLogs' to collect all logs.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to '' to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to 'AllMetrics' to collect all metrics.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to '' to disable log collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
Required. The Virtual Network (vNet) Name.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Required. An Array of 1 or more IP Address Prefixes for the Virtual Network.
Optional. An Array of subnets to deploy to the Virtual Network.
Optional. DNS Servers associated to the Virtual Network.

Optional. Resource ID of the DDoS protection plan to assign the VNET to. If it's left blank, DDoS protection will not be configured. If it's provided, the VNET created by this template will be attached to the referenced DDoS protection plan. The DDoS protection plan can exist in the same or in a different subscription.
Optional. Virtual Network Peerings configurations.

Optional. Indicates if encryption is enabled on virtual network and if VM without encryption is allowed in encrypted VNet. Requires the EnableVNetEncryption feature to be registered for the subscription and a supported region to use this property.
Optional. If the encrypted VNet allows VM that does not support encryption. Can only be used when vnetEncryption is enabled.

Optional. The flow timeout in minutes for the Virtual Network, which is used to enable connection tracking for intra-VM flows. Possible values are between 4 and 30 minutes. Default value 0 will set the property to null.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Virtual Network Subnets
metadata.description: This module deploys a Virtual Network Subnet.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container"
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. The Name of the subnet resource.
Conditional. The name of the parent virtual network. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The address prefix for the subnet.
Optional. The resource ID of the network security group to assign to the subnet.
Optional. The resource ID of the route table to assign to the subnet.
Optional. The service endpoints to enable on the subnet.
Optional. The delegations to enable on the subnet.
Optional. The resource ID of the NAT Gateway to use for the subnet.
Optional. enable or disable apply network policies on private endpoint in the subnet.
Optional. enable or disable apply network policies on private link service in the subnet.
Optional. List of address prefixes for the subnet.
Optional. Application gateway IP configurations of virtual network resource.
Optional. Array of IpAllocation which reference this subnet.
Optional. An array of service endpoint policies.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
The resource group the virtual network peering was deployed into.
The name of the virtual network peering.
The resource ID of the virtual network peering.
The address prefix for the subnet.
List of address prefixes for the subnet.

metadata.name: Virtual Network Peerings
metadata.description: This module deploys a Virtual Network Peering.
Optional. The Name of Vnet Peering resource. If not provided, default value will be localVnetName-remoteVnetName.
Conditional. The name of the parent Virtual Network to add the peering to. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The Resource ID of the VNet that is this Local VNet is being peered to. Should be in the format of a Resource ID.
Optional. Whether the forwarded traffic from the VMs in the local virtual network will be allowed/disallowed in remote virtual network. Default is true.
Optional. If gateway links can be used in remote virtual networking to link to this virtual network. Default is false.
Optional. Whether the VMs in the local virtual network space would be able to access the VMs in remote virtual network space. Default is true.
Optional. If we need to verify the provisioning state of the remote gateway. Default is true.

Optional. If remote gateways can be used on this virtual network. If the flag is set to true, and allowGatewayTransit on remote peering is also true, virtual network will use gateways of remote virtual network for transit. Only one peering can have this flag set to true. This flag cannot be set if virtual network already has a gateway. Default is false.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
The resource group the virtual network peering was deployed into.
The name of the virtual network peering.
The resource ID of the virtual network peering.

metadata.name: Virtual Network Peerings
metadata.description: This module deploys a Virtual Network Peering.
Optional. The Name of Vnet Peering resource. If not provided, default value will be localVnetName-remoteVnetName.
Conditional. The name of the parent Virtual Network to add the peering to. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The Resource ID of the VNet that is this Local VNet is being peered to. Should be in the format of a Resource ID.
Optional. Whether the forwarded traffic from the VMs in the local virtual network will be allowed/disallowed in remote virtual network. Default is true.
Optional. If gateway links can be used in remote virtual networking to link to this virtual network. Default is false.
Optional. Whether the VMs in the local virtual network space would be able to access the VMs in remote virtual network space. Default is true.
Optional. If we need to verify the provisioning state of the remote gateway. Default is true.

Optional. If remote gateways can be used on this virtual network. If the flag is set to true, and allowGatewayTransit on remote peering is also true, virtual network will use gateways of remote virtual network for transit. Only one peering can have this flag set to true. This flag cannot be set if virtual network already has a gateway. Default is false.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
The resource group the virtual network peering was deployed into.
The name of the virtual network peering.
The resource ID of the virtual network peering.
The resource group the virtual network was deployed into.
The resource ID of the virtual network.
The name of the virtual network.
The names of the deployed subnets.
The resource IDs of the deployed subnets.
The location the resource was deployed into.

metadata.name: Private DNS Zones
metadata.description: This module deploys a Private DNS zone.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container"
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Required. Private DNS zone name.
Optional. Array of A records.
Optional. Array of AAAA records.
Optional. Array of CNAME records.
Optional. Array of MX records.
Optional. Array of PTR records.
Optional. Array of SOA records.
Optional. Array of SRV records.
Optional. Array of TXT records.

Optional. Array of custom objects describing vNet links of the DNS zone. Each object should contain properties 'vnetResourceId' and 'registrationEnabled'. The 'vnetResourceId' is a resource ID of a vNet to link, 'registrationEnabled' (bool) enables automatic DNS registration in the zone for the linked vNet.
Optional. The location of the PrivateDNSZone. Should be global.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Storage Accounts
metadata.description: This module deploys a Storage Account.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The resource ID(s) to assign to the resource.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container"
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. The name of the private endpoint.
Optional. The location to deploy the private endpoint to.
Required. The service (sub-) type to deploy the private endpoint for. For example "vault" or "blob".
Required. Resource ID of the subnet where the endpoint needs to be created.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group to create if privateDnsZoneResourceIds were provided.
Optional. The private DNS zone groups to associate the private endpoint with. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Required. Fqdn that resolves to private endpoint ip address.
Required. A list of private ip addresses of the private endpoint.
Optional. Custom DNS configurations.
Required. The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group.
Required. The ID of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.
Required. The member name of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.
Required. A private ip address obtained from the private endpoint's subnet.
Required. Properties of private endpoint IP configurations.
Optional. A list of IP configurations of the private endpoint. This will be used to map to the First Party Service endpoints.
Optional. Application security groups in which the private endpoint IP configuration is included.
Optional. The custom name of the network interface attached to the private endpoint.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Tags to be applied on all resources/resource groups in this deployment.
Optional. Manual PrivateLink Service Connections.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to 'AllMetrics' to collect all metrics.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to '' to disable log collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
Required. The resource ID of a key vault to reference a customer managed key for encryption from.
Required. The name of the customer managed key to use for encryption.
Optional. The version of the customer managed key to reference for encryption. If not provided, using 'latest'.
Optional. User assigned identity to use when fetching the customer managed key. Required if no system assigned identity is available for use.
Required. Name of the Storage Account.
Optional. Location for all resources.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. The managed identity definition for this resource.
Optional. Type of Storage Account to create.
Optional. Storage Account Sku Name.

Conditional. Required if the Storage Account kind is set to BlobStorage. The access tier is used for billing. The "Premium" access tier is the default value for premium block blobs storage account type and it cannot be changed for the premium block blobs storage account type.

Optional. Allow large file shares if sets to 'Enabled'. It cannot be disabled once it is enabled. Only supported on locally redundant and zone redundant file shares. It cannot be set on FileStorage storage accounts (storage accounts for premium file shares).
Optional. Provides the identity based authentication settings for Azure Files.
Optional. A boolean flag which indicates whether the default authentication is OAuth or not.

Optional. Indicates whether the storage account permits requests to be authorized with the account access key via Shared Key. If false, then all requests, including shared access signatures, must be authorized with Azure Active Directory (Azure AD). The default value is null, which is equivalent to true.
Optional. Configuration details for private endpoints. For security reasons, it is recommended to use private endpoints whenever possible.
Optional. The Storage Account ManagementPolicies Rules.
Optional. Networks ACLs, this value contains IPs to whitelist and/or Subnet information. For security reasons, it is recommended to set the DefaultAction Deny.

Optional. A Boolean indicating whether or not the service applies a secondary layer of encryption with platform managed keys for data at rest. For security reasons, it is recommended to set it to true.
Optional. Allow or disallow cross AAD tenant object replication.
Optional. Sets the custom domain name assigned to the storage account. Name is the CNAME source.
Optional. Indicates whether indirect CName validation is enabled. This should only be set on updates.

Optional. Allows you to specify the type of endpoint. Set this to AzureDNSZone to create a large number of accounts in a single subscription, which creates accounts in an Azure DNS Zone and the endpoint URL will have an alphanumeric DNS Zone identifier.
Optional. Blob service and containers to deploy.
Optional. File service and shares to deploy.
Optional. Queue service and queues to create.
Optional. Table service and tables to create.
Optional. Indicates whether public access is enabled for all blobs or containers in the storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set it to false.
Optional. Set the minimum TLS version on request to storage.
Conditional. If true, enables Hierarchical Namespace for the storage account. Required if enableSftp or enableNfsV3 is set to true.
Optional. If true, enables Secure File Transfer Protocol for the storage account. Requires enableHierarchicalNamespace to be true.
Optional. Local users to deploy for SFTP authentication.
Optional. Enables local users feature, if set to true.
Optional. If true, enables NFS 3.0 support for the storage account. Requires enableHierarchicalNamespace to be true.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
Optional. Restrict copy to and from Storage Accounts within an AAD tenant or with Private Links to the same VNet.

Optional. Whether or not public network access is allowed for this resource. For security reasons it should be disabled. If not specified, it will be disabled by default if private endpoints are set and networkAcls are not set.
Optional. Allows HTTPS traffic only to storage service if sets to true.
Optional. The customer managed key definition.
Optional. The SAS expiration period. DD.HH:MM:SS.

variables.formattedUserAssignedIdentities: [reduce(map(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourcesIds'), createArray()), lambda('id', createObject(format('{0}', lambdaVariables('id')), createObject()))), createObject(), lambda('cur', 'next', union(lambdaVariables('cur'), lambdaVariables('next'))))]
variables.identity: [if(not(empty(parameters('managedIdentities'))), createObject('type', if(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'systemAssigned'), false()), if(not(empty(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourcesIds'), createObject()))), 'SystemAssigned,UserAssigned', 'SystemAssigned'), if(not(empty(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourcesIds'), createObject()))), 'UserAssigned', null())), 'userAssignedIdentities', if(not(empty(variables('formattedUserAssignedIdentities'))), variables('formattedUserAssignedIdentities'), null())), null())]

properties.networkAcls: [if(not(empty(parameters('networkAcls'))), createObject('bypass', if(contains(parameters('networkAcls'), 'bypass'), parameters('networkAcls').bypass, null()), 'defaultAction', if(contains(parameters('networkAcls'), 'defaultAction'), parameters('networkAcls').defaultAction, null()), 'virtualNetworkRules', if(contains(parameters('networkAcls'), 'virtualNetworkRules'), parameters('networkAcls').virtualNetworkRules, createArray()), 'ipRules', if(contains(parameters('networkAcls'), 'ipRules'), parameters('networkAcls').ipRules, createArray())), null())]

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

name.value: [coalesce(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'name'), format('pep-{0}-{1}-{2}', last(split(resourceId('Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts', parameters('name')), '/')), coalesce(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'service'), coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()].service), copyIndex()))]

metadata.name: Storage Account blob Services
metadata.description: This module deploys a Storage Account Blob Service.
Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to 'AllLogs' to collect all logs.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to '' to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to 'AllMetrics' to collect all metrics.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to '' to disable log collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
Conditional. The name of the parent Storage Account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. Automatic Snapshot is enabled if set to true.
Optional. The blob service properties for change feed events. Indicates whether change feed event logging is enabled for the Blob service.

Optional. Indicates whether change feed event logging is enabled for the Blob service. Indicates the duration of changeFeed retention in days. A "0" value indicates an infinite retention of the change feed.
Optional. The blob service properties for container soft delete. Indicates whether DeleteRetentionPolicy is enabled.
Optional. Indicates the number of days that the deleted item should be retained.

Optional. This property when set to true allows deletion of the soft deleted blob versions and snapshots. This property cannot be used with blob restore policy. This property only applies to blob service and does not apply to containers or file share.

Optional. Specifies CORS rules for the Blob service. You can include up to five CorsRule elements in the request. If no CorsRule elements are included in the request body, all CORS rules will be deleted, and CORS will be disabled for the Blob service.

Optional. Indicates the default version to use for requests to the Blob service if an incoming request's version is not specified. Possible values include version 2008-10-27 and all more recent versions.
Optional. The blob service properties for blob soft delete.
Optional. Indicates the number of days that the deleted blob should be retained.

Optional. This property when set to true allows deletion of the soft deleted blob versions and snapshots. This property cannot be used with blob restore policy. This property only applies to blob service and does not apply to containers or file share.
Optional. Use versioning to automatically maintain previous versions of your blobs.
Optional. The blob service property to configure last access time based tracking policy. When set to true last access time based tracking is enabled.
Optional. The blob service properties for blob restore policy. If point-in-time restore is enabled, then versioning, change feed, and blob soft delete must also be enabled.
Optional. how long this blob can be restored. It should be less than DeleteRetentionPolicy days.
Optional. Blob containers to create.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).

metadata.name: Storage Account Blob Containers
metadata.description: This module deploys a Storage Account Blob Container.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Conditional. The name of the parent Storage Account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the storage container to deploy.
Optional. Default the container to use specified encryption scope for all writes.
Optional. Block override of encryption scope from the container default.
Optional. Enable NFSv3 all squash on blob container.
Optional. Enable NFSv3 root squash on blob container.

Optional. This is an immutable property, when set to true it enables object level immutability at the container level. The property is immutable and can only be set to true at the container creation time. Existing containers must undergo a migration process.
Optional. Name of the immutable policy.
Optional. Configure immutability policy.
Optional. A name-value pair to associate with the container as metadata.
Optional. Specifies whether data in the container may be accessed publicly and the level of access.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).

metadata.name: Storage Account Blob Container Immutability Policies
metadata.description: This module deploys a Storage Account Blob Container Immutability Policy.
Conditional. The name of the parent Storage Account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Conditional. The name of the parent container to apply the policy to. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. The immutability period for the blobs in the container since the policy creation, in days.

Optional. This property can only be changed for unlocked time-based retention policies. When enabled, new blocks can be written to an append blob while maintaining immutability protection and compliance. Only new blocks can be added and any existing blocks cannot be modified or deleted. This property cannot be changed with ExtendImmutabilityPolicy API.

Optional. This property can only be changed for unlocked time-based retention policies. When enabled, new blocks can be written to both "Append and Block Blobs" while maintaining immutability protection and compliance. Only new blocks can be added and any existing blocks cannot be modified or deleted. This property cannot be changed with ExtendImmutabilityPolicy API. The "allowProtectedAppendWrites" and "allowProtectedAppendWritesAll" properties are mutually exclusive.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
The name of the deployed immutability policy.
The resource ID of the deployed immutability policy.
The resource group of the deployed immutability policy.
The name of the deployed container.
The resource ID of the deployed container.
The resource group of the deployed container.
The name of the deployed blob service.
The resource ID of the deployed blob service.
The name of the deployed blob service.

Conditional. The name of the parent Storage Account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Conditional. The name of the parent file service. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the file share to create.

Conditional. Access tier for specific share. Required if the Storage Account kind is set to FileStorage (should be set to "Premium"). GpV2 account can choose between TransactionOptimized (default), Hot, and Cool.
Optional. The maximum size of the share, in gigabytes. Must be greater than 0, and less than or equal to 5120 (5TB). For Large File Shares, the maximum size is 102400 (100TB).
Optional. The authentication protocol that is used for the file share. Can only be specified when creating a share.
Optional. Permissions for NFS file shares are enforced by the client OS rather than the Azure Files service. Toggling the root squash behavior reduces the rights of the root user for NFS shares.

Conditional. The name of the parent Storage Account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of the table.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
The name of the deployed file share service.
The resource ID of the deployed file share service.
The resource group of the deployed file share service.
The name of the deployed table service.
The resource ID of the deployed table service.
The resource group of the deployed table service.
The resource ID of the deployed storage account.
The name of the deployed storage account.
The resource group of the deployed storage account.
The primary blob endpoint reference if blob services are deployed.
The principal ID of the system assigned identity.
The location the resource was deployed into.

metadata.name: Container Apps
metadata.description: This module deploys a Container App.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The resource ID(s) to assign to the resource.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container"
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Required. Name of the Container App.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. Bool indicating if app exposes an external http endpoint.
Optional. Ingress transport protocol.
Optional. Bool indicating if HTTP connections to is allowed. If set to false HTTP connections are automatically redirected to HTTPS connections.
Optional. Target Port in containers for traffic from ingress.
Optional. Maximum number of container replicas. Defaults to 10 if not set.
Optional. Minimum number of container replicas.
Optional. Scaling rules.
Optional. ActiveRevisionsMode controls how active revisions are handled for the Container app.
Required. Resource ID of environment.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Collection of private container registry credentials for containers used by the Container app.
Optional. The managed identity definition for this resource.
Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
Optional. Custom domain bindings for Container App hostnames.
Optional. Exposed Port in containers for TCP traffic from ingress.
Optional. Rules to restrict incoming IP address.
Optional. Associates a traffic label with a revision. Label name should be consist of lower case alphanumeric characters or dashes.
Optional. Indicates that the traffic weight belongs to a latest stable revision.
Optional. Name of a revision.
Optional. Traffic weight assigned to a revision.
Optional. Dapr configuration for the Container App.
Optional. Max inactive revisions a Container App can have.
Required. List of container definitions for the Container App.
Optional. List of specialized containers that run before app containers.
Optional. The secrets of the Container App.
Optional. User friendly suffix that is appended to the revision name.
Optional. List of volume definitions for the Container App.
Optional. Workload profile type to pin for container app execution.

variables.formattedUserAssignedIdentities: [reduce(map(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourcesIds'), createArray()), lambda('id', createObject(format('{0}', lambdaVariables('id')), createObject()))), createObject(), lambda('cur', 'next', union(lambdaVariables('cur'), lambdaVariables('next'))))]
variables.identity: [if(not(empty(parameters('managedIdentities'))), createObject('type', if(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'systemAssigned'), false()), if(not(empty(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourcesIds'), createObject()))), 'SystemAssigned,UserAssigned', 'SystemAssigned'), if(not(empty(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourcesIds'), createObject()))), 'UserAssigned', null())), 'userAssignedIdentities', if(not(empty(variables('formattedUserAssignedIdentities'))), variables('formattedUserAssignedIdentities'), null())), null())]

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]
